page.title: 19FARMING
page.content: a survey was asked at the farms in the grids. 12 farms replied. There was a nil return from Shepherds Hall farm because the land has been opencasted. THE farmhouses arebuilt of sandstone in the vernacular style and are all over 1oo years of age. The land is used for mixed farming. There were 729 acres of rented land and 968 acres of owned land. these acres were used as follows. Pasture 1428 acres. Fodder crops 348 acres. Cash crops 96 acres. The crops grown were Barley 185 acres Grass for hay 156 acres. Grass for silage 484 acres Turnips 14 acres. Potatoes 17 acres.
